thread.title: Innocent woman’s home burned in apparent neighbour feud | Globalnews.ca
thread.title_full: Innocent woman’s home burned in apparent neighbour feud | Globalnews.ca

author: Lauren Pullen
title: Innocent woman’s home burned in apparent neighbour feud | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 3, 2017 6:03 pm Innocent woman’s home burned in apparent neighbour feud By Lauren Pullen Anchor/Reporter Global News What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
A bizarre series of events in Edgewood, a small community is south of Nakusp, ended with a home being destroyed by fire. 
A man, apparently upset over his neighbours having a loud party, allegedly attended the gathering wielding a chainsaw and attempted to cut down a hydro pole that carried electricity lines to the residence. 
The 44-year-old was arrested, and the next night his home was destroyed by fire. 
That home belonged to his mother. 
Family friends have now rallied around the woman on facebook , saying she is an innocent bystander in this neighbour feud. 
She lost everything in the fire and doesn’t have insurance. © 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
